snippet: As the Supreme Court prepares to consider two major First Amendment cases, a recent study examined data from 1953-2011 and asserted that the current court rules in favor of free speech at a lower rate than previous ones.
abstract: Study by Monica Youn of New York University School of Law asserts that Supreme Court under Chief Justice John G Roberts Jr has ruled in favor of free speech at a lower rate than previous courts; findings contradict claims by leading scholars and practitioners that the current court is the most pro-First Amendment court in American history; study arrives as the court prepares to consider two major First Amendment cases.
lead_paragraph: As the Supreme Court prepares to consider two major First Amendment cases, a recent study examined data from 1953-2011 and asserted that the current court rules in favor of free speech at a lower rate than previous ones.

headline.main: Study Challenges Supreme Court’s Image as Defender of Free Speech
headline.print_headline: Study Challenges Supreme Court’s Image as Defender of Free Speech
